newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodia's Hun Sen appeals to country's poor.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia's Hun Sen appeals to country's poor.

text.p: Cambodia's Second Prime Minister Hun Sen said in an election-campaign style speech on Saturday that only a person from a poor background could understand the poor.
Hun Sen and his uneasy coalition partner, First Prime Minister Prince Norodom Ranariddh agreed last week that Cambodia's next election will be on May 23.

Ranariddh and Hun Sen share power in a coalition formed after United Nations-supervised elections in 1993 but relations between the two have been deteriorating since last year when Ranariddh demanded a greater share of power.
Hun Sen said in his speech in Kompong Cham province, north of Phnom Penh, that someone born in a palace could never understand poor people.
"Only the poor can understand the poor. People born in the high class, people born in a royal palace, they don't know the poor," he said.
Hun Sen comes from a humble background while Ranariddh, whom he did not name in his speech, is the son of King Norodom Sihanouk.
Political analysts expect a close and hard-fought campaign for the May general election.
The splintering Khmer Rouge guerrilla group has also become a major source of friction between the two men with both vying for political gain as the guerrilla group breaks up.
There has been mounting international concern about political violence in the country since bodyguards loyal to the two men fought a gun battle in central Phnom Penh earlier this month.
